intro: Leucopogon colensoi, commonly known as the Colenso's heath, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the heath family (Ericaceae) and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or subalpine regions. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Leucopogon colensoi plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
